channel.title: Help im new just started
channel.description: I wanted to make a client and server so i used the galkons base client and testscape base server and i think im doing pretty good. Evrytime i try to change player rights though they change right back after i log in. And i wanna be the owner and make other people admin and stuff so a tutorial on that would be good. Now i need to know how to make it so only admins, owners, and co owners can spawn stuff using commands. I would like to be able to sell items to shops too. Im new to this just started like 2 hrs ago and im stuck. Any tutorials would be great.

item.title: Help im new just started
item.dc:creator: @nsteger123 nsteger123
item.description:
@nsteger123 wrote:

im strarting over…any suggestions for a good base sevrer to start out with. I need to know how to autospawn, add drops, make shops, add items to shops, and anything else i need for a server. Links and pictures would help. I need to know everything! So please help out. Anyone that helps alot i will make you an admin in my server(in you want)! You can pm me tutorials or post them here in in tuts section.

Read full topic

item.title: Help im new just started
item.dc:creator: @Sir_Schmoopy Sir Schmoopy
item.description:
@Sir_Schmoopy wrote:

As for the where.
Go into client.java
Search for

public void customCommand

Or just search for custom untill it says customcommand.
Then under that you can add the code for pickup.

Read full topic

item.title: Help im new just started
item.dc:creator: @T_A_G T A G
item.description:
@T_A_G wrote:

To answer the spawn one just add this

}
if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerRights >= 2)) {
try {
String[] token = command.split(" ");
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(token[1]);
int newItemAmount = 1;

                        try {
                            newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(token[2]); // fixup of your pickup
                        } catch (Exception e) {
                            newItemAmount = 1;
                        }
                        if (newItemID <= 9000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                            addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
                        } else {
                            message("No such item");
                        }
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                        message(
                                "I think you typed that wrong, e.g. ::pickup 995 1");
                    }
                }
            }

Read full topic
